intro: Lagenandra keralensis, commonly known as the Keralan lagenandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
